subs.text: June 2022

subs.text: June 24
@jenrazzle @HejM0 Hope seems like it was a century ago [link]
subs.rawText: @jenrazzle @HejM0 Hope seems like it was a century ago https://t.co/0RjLcGuIBf

subs.text: This train wreck was over 10 years in the making, and the party that would have, could have, should have prevented it… didn’t.
subs.rawText: This train wreck was over 10 years in the making, and the party that would have, could have, should have prevented it… didn’t.

subs.text: I decided a few years to let that party wander aimlessly without me (but they still have my vote) and joined a German party. I may not be able to vote here yet, but I helped pick party leaders and a Chancellor candidate who’s now in power.
subs.rawText: I decided a few years to let that party wander aimlessly without me (but they still have my vote) and joined a German party. I may not be able to vote here yet, but I helped pick party leaders and a Chancellor candidate who’s now in power.

subs.text: And is checking off the boxes on their campaign promises, like just today on freedom of information for abortion providers [link]
subs.rawText: And is checking off the boxes on their campaign promises, like just today on freedom of information for abortion providers https://t.co/lDiTROwiTX

subs.text: Political involvement is also part business strategy. My wife belongs to the other main German party, but the left wing of the one party overlaps a lot with the right wing of the other. We then have a foot in the door of a lot of politicians where we can voice our concerns.
subs.rawText: Political involvement is also part business strategy. My wife belongs to the other main German party, but the left wing of the one party overlaps a lot with the right wing of the other. We then have a foot in the door of a lot of politicians where we can voice our concerns.

subs.text: Or to do good. Through personal, media and political contacts, we were able to prevent an Afghan couple who work for us from deportation. They’ve now become permanent residents. /Fin [link]
subs.rawText: Or to do good. Through personal, media and political contacts, we were able to prevent an Afghan couple who work for us from deportation. They’ve now become permanent residents. /Fin https://t.co/nR59In9Amk

subs.text: My wife drives a plug-in hybrid (her EV is on order), but drives in EV mode whenever she can. She hasn’t filled up the gas tank in 3 months, and now the car complains that her gas is getting old… 🤣 [link]

subs.text: @bzbear2 I heard on the news last night that on midsummer Hamburg has an hour more daylight than Munich. I didn’t realize the difference was so much.
subs.rawText: @bzbear2 I heard on the news last night that on midsummer Hamburg has an hour more daylight than Munich. I didn’t realize the difference was so much.

subs.text: So given the piles of luggage from missed connections at European hub airports, for our US trip in July we should switch to a 3 hour layover in Amsterdam instead of 1 hour (even if it means leaving for the airport at 3:30 am).

subs.text: And aging is just a cruel joke on your body, right? Running 5K with only one practice run I would have expected my legs or my feet to hurt afterwards, but it’s my upper back! #60plus
subs.rawText: And aging is just a cruel joke on your body, right? Running 5K with only one practice run I would have expected my legs or my feet to hurt afterwards, but it’s my upper back! #60plus

subs.text: @PurlTurtle We did not have a computer at home growing up (I left for college in 1980). The high school had one Apple ][ for all students. Our CompSci assignments we did over dial-up on a mainframe.
subs.rawText: @PurlTurtle We did not have a computer at home growing up (I left for college in 1980). The high school had one Apple ][ for all students. Our CompSci assignments we did over dial-up on a mainframe.

subs.text: @PurlTurtle @ClaireSmith1848 Let’s just say it’s a bad idea to plan a fall meeting on a cruise ship. Bad waves, half of us got seasick and the entertainment (DJ you-know-you) almost refused to perform. OTOH we had great bike tours at the port stops in Cannes and Barcelona.
subs.rawText: @PurlTurtle @ClaireSmith1848 Let’s just say it’s a bad idea to plan a fall meeting on a cruise ship. Bad waves, half of us got seasick and the entertainment (DJ you-know-you) almost refused to perform. OTOH we had great bike tours at the port stops in Cannes and Barcelona.

subs.text: @JReggel First time for us, we never imagined there’d be so many people! Da steppt der Bär!
subs.rawText: @JReggel First time for us, we never imagined there’d be so many people! Da steppt der Bär!

subs.text: Another 45 km biked today (Jork to Stade and back, through the Altes Land where they grow the apples) and we’re pooped! 120 km over 2 days. Now we’re home, so we’ll just get take-out and go to bed before dark. [link]
subs.rawText: Another 45 km biked today (Jork to Stade and back, through the Altes Land where they grow the apples) and we’re pooped! 120 km over 2 days. Now we’re home, so we’ll just get take-out and go to bed before dark. https://t.co/bluMxltQv9

subs.text: In three pieces because I’m still figuring out @komoot, which gave great audio navigation and visual directions to my watch with the iPhone in offline mode. Wasn’t able to figure out how to bail out of a planned tour on the fly, though. We were tired and hungry! [link]
subs.rawText: In three pieces because I’m still figuring out @komoot, which gave great audio navigation and visual directions to my watch with the iPhone in offline mode. Wasn’t able to figure out how to bail out of a planned tour on the fly, though. We were tired and hungry! https://t.co/NxdQ3zk2ug

subs.text: @cncx Similar for us. We were in the US for 2 weeks in April. We got sore throats the second day, so mild we didn’t think it could be Corona, so we didn’t test. Sore throat gone after 3 days. Ten days later back in Germany I test positive. My wife didn’t, but I bet she had it too.
subs.rawText: @cncx Similar for us. We were in the US for 2 weeks in April. We got sore throats the second day, so mild we didn’t think it could be Corona, so we didn’t test. Sore throat gone after 3 days. Ten days later back in Germany I test positive. My wife didn’t, but I bet she had it too.

subs.text: @jrsofty Not just tastes differ, but regulations and suppliers too. For example our fryer oil has less preservatives than that in the US. Right now our recipe for fryer oil is being changed because of the shortage of sunflower oil.

subs.text: Europes largest rail switchyard is in Maschen near Hamburg, serving the harbor. That bridge for cars going across (built in 1973) has been closed since 2016, rebuilding will be complicated as it may contain asbestos. Construction might start in 2024. [link] https://t.co/XSPm10TcUf
subs.rawText: Europes largest rail switchyard is in Maschen near Hamburg, serving the harbor. That bridge for cars going across (built in 1973) has been closed since 2016, rebuilding will be complicated as it may contain asbestos. Construction might start in 2024. https://t.co/t9gyqEvzka https://t.co/XSPm10TcUf
